Complete the loop by drawing Line 7: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0]. **Creating the 3D Model:** 1. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale = 0.75. 2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into the 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. 3. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis, creating a depth towards the normal of 0.5306, constructing a 3D solid model with the final dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.5306 - Height: 0.75 At this point, you can proceed to create any new parts as required by the CAD Assembly JSON. Remember to follow the instructions provided for each part, starting with the shape to be constructed, followed by the detailed step-by-step instructions to build that part. It is essential to provide a new coordinate system for each part, along with the appropriate scaling, transformations, and extrusions.</description>

Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. The final assembly should match the provided description and dimensions.</description>
